alert.note: Alert for Northern Salinas Valley, Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 13 at 9:59PM PST until December 14 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM PST TUESDAY... ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE DOLAN BURN AREA REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Northern Salinas Valley/Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley, Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast. * WHEN...Until 3 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to heavy rain will be possible through late tonight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Carmel, River and Willow burn areas. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following areas, Northern Salinas Valley/Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley, Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Carmel, River and Willow burn areas is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Carmel, River and Willow burn areas should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Soils remain moist and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Significant runoff may cause flooding of creeks and rivers. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Carmel, River and Willow burn areas, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northern Salinas Valley, Hollister Valley and Carmel Valley
